poem:
**Rayner in Ibiza**

In dawn's amber glow,
beyond the parliaments' shadow, 
beats pulse through,
Rayner's hands spin—
Gotye's echoes diffuse, 
a crowd sways.

Politic's tether cast off,
beneath Hi's neon sky,
her voice, resolute,
remixes old into new.
Dawn and dusk blur;
roles, once rigid,
softly dissolve.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Rayner the raver: deputy PM spotted behind decks at Ibiza club Politicians of all stripes have been chasing the “brat” label all summer, but only one has come close to truly pulling off the role. On Thursday, Angela Rayner was spotted raving behind a DJ deck in Ibiza, belting out the lyrics to a remix of Gotye’s hit song Somebody That I Used to Know to a large, cheering crowd. She was partying at Hi". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Rayner the raver: deputy PM spotted behind decks at Ibiza club Politicians of all stripes have been chasing the “brat” label all summer, but only one has come close to truly pulling off the role. On Thursday, Angela Rayner was spotted raving behind a DJ deck in Ibiza, belting out the lyrics to a remix of Gotye’s hit song Somebody That I Used to Know to a large, cheering crowd. She was partying at Hi
